articles.title: Government bonds rally on RBI’s liquidity push
articles.summary: Government bonds rallied as the central bank announced significant liquidity infusion measures, including ₹2 lakh crore in bond purchases and a $10 billion dollar-rupee swap. This move aims to ease tight liquidity conditions caused by forex market intervention and tax outflows, with the 10-year bond yield dropping sharply.

articles.title: Explained: Sebi eases norms for duplicate securities, increases limit, and simplifies documentation. 5 things to know
articles.summary: The Securities and Exchange Board of India has doubled the monetary threshold for simplified documentation when issuing duplicate securities. Investors holding securities valued up to Rs 10 lakh will now face fewer procedural burdens. This move aims to ease compliance and remove inconsistencies. Notarisation of the Affidavit-cum-Indemnity Bond is also waived for securities up to Rs 10,000.

articles.title: Toy industry in the State is now worth around ₹1,000 crore
articles.summary: December witnessed two significant developments — one involving Funskool, the Chennai-headquartered toy manufacturer, and the other emerging from the temple town of Madurai. Funskool announced its foray into the electronic toys segment with the launch of a new product range, while Madurai-based Rigwheels, which began operations in 2024, unveiled its debut product — the Vande Bharat toy train

articles.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Friday
articles.summary: Indian markets ended lower in thin pre-Christmas trade as foreign selling and a lack of triggers weighed on sentiment, with Sensex and Nifty slipping marginally. Analysts said trading remained subdued in the holiday-shortened week, though RBI liquidity steps may support markets amid mixed global cues.

articles.title: Risk of AI-led disruptions to white-collar jobs lesser in India than West: IT Secretary Krishnan
articles.summary: Krishnan said AI's (Artificial Intelligence) real impact will come from building and deploying sector and use-specific applications, a process that will require large numbers of trained professionals. He added that this is where India's strength lies and where new AI-driven job opportunities will emerge.

articles.title: This Navratna PSU stock tanks 18% in 2025, poised for first annual fall since 2019. Are you holding?
articles.summary: In 2025, Rail Vikas Nigam's stock fell significantly, losing 18.22% amid a challenging market. Although recent government fare adjustments and new contracts boosted sentiment, the stock is on track for its first annual loss since its market debut.

articles.title: India tops global IPO volumes in November; ranks second in issue value at $3.7 billion, ahead of US
articles.summary: India led global IPOs in November with 22 listings. The nation secured second place for funds raised, collecting $3.7 billion. Asian markets were strong, contributing over $12 billion to the global total. Indian IPOs showed robust performance, with many mainboard and SME issues listing at a premium. Financial services led fundraising in mainboard IPOs.

articles.title: Vikran Engineering share price to be in focus on Friday on securing  ₹459 crore order from NTPC Renewable Energy
articles.summary: Vikran Engineering has secured a ₹459.20 crore solar project contract from NTPC Renewable Energy, marking a significant milestone in its diversification strategy. This follows another order worth ₹2,035.26 crore, bringing the total to ₹2,494 crore, above its market cap.

articles.title: UPI Autopay volume doubles in a year, NPCI launches portal for e-mandate management
articles.summary: UPI Autopay is experiencing rapid growth. Recurring payments via UPI Autopay have doubled in the last year. This surge is fueled by increased adoption and a higher transaction limit. NPCI has also launched a new portal to manage mandates. UPI is becoming the preferred payment method across India.

articles.title: Why 10–20% global allocation makes sense for most Indian investors, Inderbir Singh Jolly decodes
articles.summary: As Indian equity markets hit new highs, investors increasingly recognise the value of global diversification. With India accounting for only ~4–4.5% of global market capitalisation, overseas markets offer access to structural growth themes, innovation, and currency diversification. Experts recommend allocating 10–20% of portfolios to global assets, via ETFs, international mutual funds, or direct stock investment through LRS, to enhance resilience and long-term wealth creation.

articles.title: Domain-led strategy for growth as AI blurs line between engineering and IT: Tata Technologies CTO
articles.summary: In view of the changes, the global product engineering and digital services firm is prioritising its service portfolio while maintaining its core strengths in engineering research and digital enterprise solutions, CTO Sriram Lakshminarayanan told PTI in an interaction.

articles.title: Samsung is not going the LG way, rules out India IPO for now
articles.summary: Samsung Electronics has ruled out an IPO for its India business, prioritizing AI integration across products and expanding its consumer finance arm. The company aims to deepen its manufacturing footprint by applying for the PLI scheme to produce mobile phone displays in India, signaling confidence in long-term growth.

articles.title: Indian exports set to rise 3% to $850 billion in FY26, GTRI data suggests tougher trade outlook ahead
articles.summary: Indian exports are likely to rise by 3% to $850 billion in the financial year ending 2025-26, Global Trade Research Initiative (GTRI) data suggest that tougher global trade environment than what the country has seen in recent years.

articles.title: Why 2026 could mark a payoff year for India’s economy
articles.summary: After tariffs, floods and global shocks, India may be nearing a reform payoff. Economists see 2026 delivering the lagged gains of tax relief, rate cuts and regulatory changes—despite external risks.

articles.title: A rational framework to choose the right health insurance
articles.summary: Evaluate health insurers using four key metrics: claim settlement ratio, incurred claims ratio, complaints ratio, and network hospitals. Match policy features to your specific needs and life stage.

articles.title: Why the AI rally (and the bubble talk) could continue next year
articles.summary: The AI revolution is fueling a massive investment boom, with some experts warning of an inevitable bubble. Transformative technologies historically lead to asset inflation, and AI's rapid integration into markets and the economy is no exception. Concerns are rising as AI's impact on GDP growth and market valuations intensifies.

articles.title: Policy interest rate consistent with macroeconomic stability, says RBI MPC member Saugata Bhattacharya
articles.summary: Update from Indian Express - India

articles.title: Nvidia, joining Big Tech deal spree, to license Groq technology, hire executives
articles.summary: Nvidia has licensed chip technology from startup Groq and hired its CEO, a former Google AI veteran. This deal follows a trend of tech giants acquiring talent and technology without full acquisitions. While Nvidia leads AI training, Groq specializes in inference, a more competitive market. Groq will continue operating independently.

articles.title: Two-thirds of Nifty 500 stocks trade in overvalued zone
articles.summary: A study by Omniscience Capital reveals that nearly 65% of India's Nifty 500 stocks are overvalued, with the index trading at a high P/E ratio relative to its growth prospects. While financials, utilities, industrials, and energy sectors appear attractively positioned, consumer staples, healthcare, and IT sectors show overvaluation.

articles.title: Nvidia agrees to buy chip startup Groq's assets for $20 billion: Reports
articles.summary: Under the arrangement, Groq founder and CEO Jonathan Ross, who was with Google's Tensor Processing Unit, will join Nvidia along with president Sunny Madra and other key staff. Simon Edwards, Groq's finance chief, will take the helm of the company as it maintains its cloud business, GroqCloud, independently.

articles.title: Aravalli row: Yadav, Ramesh trade charges over mining and forest data
articles.summary: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh claimed that the government is imperilling the Aravallis quoting Forest Survey of India data; Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav countered it claiming that FSI has not surveyed the height of Aravalli hills

articles.title: Indian cos bond less with dollar in ’25 as price advantage recedes
articles.summary: Indian companies issued fewer dollar bonds in 2025. They preferred the domestic rupee market for refinancing debt. This shift was driven by cost savings and ample local funds. Major groups like Vedanta and GMR utilized onshore issuance. Offshore issuance is expected to recover in 2026, potentially exceeding $10 billion.

articles.title: Food and quick commerce delivery workers call for all India strike on December 25 and 31
articles.summary: Delivery workers for Zomato, Swiggy, Zepto, Blinkit, Amazon, and Flipkart plan a strike on December 25 and 31. The Indian Federation of App-Based Transport Workers and Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union are leading the action. They demand job security, higher pay, safer conditions, and social security benefits. This protest highlights concerns over worker welfare amidst platform company profits.

articles.title: MeitY to showcase 100 local apps at its AI Impact Summit
articles.summary: Focus on AI-driven solutions for grassroot challenges across global south

articles.title: Rise of micro companionship: Social media 2.0 is changing the conversation
articles.summary: India’s creator economy is branching out beyond short videos and livestreams, quietly building a parallel income stream around paid conversations, voice chats, and virtual gifting — especially in smaller towns. A new crop of “micro companionship” apps is gaining traction by monetising one-on-one and small-group interactions rather than mass reach.

articles.title: Vodafone Idea share price to be in focus on Friday as company receives two GST penalty orders
articles.summary: Vodafone Idea has received GST penalty orders amounting to over ₹83 crore. The company said the maximum financial impact would be limited to the tax demand, interest, and penalties levied.

articles.title: Top 5 last-minute Christmas tech gift ideas delivered fast by Instamart, Zepto and Blinkit
articles.summary: Looking for meaningful Christmas gifts at the last minute? This curated list of practical tech essentials includes wearables, audio gear and games that add everyday value. All five picks are available for quick doorstep delivery via Blinkit, Zepto and Instamart.

articles.title: Critical illness claim rejected by insurer? Here's what you can do
articles.summary: Always read policy wording carefully, maintain complete medical documentation, and make use of the grievance and ombudsman mechanisms when needed.

articles.title: 2025 Year in Review: IPO, offline push and M&As change maths for test-prep sector
articles.summary: India’s test-preparation segment stayed resilient in 2025 even as large parts of edtech grappled with post-pandemic fatigue, slower enrolments, and weak business models. The year was divergent for the sector: PhysicsWallah went public, while Unacademy is negotiating a sale to Upgrad at a fraction of its peak valuation.

articles.title: Where a tax NUDGE becomes an unintended and intrusive push
articles.summary: India’s trust-based tax compliance push risks backfiring as automated NUDGE alerts rely too heavily on third-party data, flagging compliant taxpayers and creating anxiety ahead of the revised return deadline.

articles.title: FSSAI warns food businesses against labeling herbal infusions as ‘tea’
articles.summary: Under FSSAI regulations, the term ‘tea’ can be used on packaging and labels only for beverages derived from Camellia sinensis

articles.title: Upcoming IPO: Yatayat Corporation files DRHP with Sebi to raise funds via share sale

The company focuses on road logistics, serving various sectors and recording significant growth in revenue and profit.

The district magistrate's directive mandates strict enforcement, with violations facing legal consequences.

articles.title: 'Don't comment, post views': Army issues policy on use of social media apps; check guidelines
articles.summary: The Army has unveiled new social media guidelines for its personnel. While platforms like Instagram and YouTube are restricted to viewing and information gathering, users can share unclassified general information on messaging apps like WhatsApp and Signal with known contacts. LinkedIn is permitted for professional networking and job seeking purposes only.

articles.summary: Indian banks are intensifying scrutiny on overseas money transfers, demanding detailed proof of fund origins from individuals and businesses. This heightened caution, particularly for remittances from NRO accounts, arises amid the rupee's slide and increased customer urgency to move funds abroad, leading to compliance hurdles.

The aviation regulator's panel is investigating, with a report on IndiGo's operational woes expected soon.

articles.title: 3 ways Google aims to support the 2024 Indian General Elections
articles.summary: Google supports the Indian General Election by providing easy access to voting information and countering misinformation. Initiatives include partnering with the Election Commission, prioritizing trusted content on YouTube, and implementing advertising policies for transparency. Measures against AI-generated content are also taken.

articles.title: 'Ready to enhance trust with India': China slams explosive US report; evasive on Pakistan ties
articles.summary: China has strongly refuted a US Pentagon report alleging it's using eased border tensions with India to undermine US-India ties. Beijing insists its defence policy is misrepresented and aims to sow discord. China maintains its border situation with India is stable and seeks to advance a sound bilateral relationship, while dismissing US claims as biased and confrontational.

articles.title: ‘No one knows where missile came from’: Nitin Gadkari recalls meeting Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh hours before assassination; how he reacted
articles.summary: Union minister Nitin Gadkari recounted meeting Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh hours before his assassination in Tehran. Gadkari, was in Iran, attending presidential swearing-in, and was informed of Haniyeh's death early next morning. The incident highlighted the growing role of technology in modern conflict and national security.

articles.title: Chipmaker TSMC returns to the list of world's 10 most valuable companies: Here’s what led to its comeback
articles.summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) has reclaimed a spot in the list of the world’s 10 most valuable companies, riding the optimism of the artificial intelligence (AI) boom. Analysts expect TSMC to further advance amid surging AI-related revenue and strong pricing power.

articles.title: Revised railway fares from December 26: Ministry notifies 'rationalised' structure; what changes for passengers
articles.summary: Indian Railways has announced a fare "rationalisation" effective December 26, aiming for affordability and operational sustainability. Suburban services and season tickets remain unchanged. Short-distance ordinary journeys up to 215 km are also unaffected. Mail/Express and AC/Non-AC ordinary services will see modest increases, with specific graded hikes for non-suburban ordinary journeys.
